About ICDRET

In the 21th Conference of the Parties (COP 2015) in Paris the parties came to a
legally binding international treaty on climate change It was adopted by 196
Parties at COP 21 in Paris The goal has been set to limit the global warming to
well below 2 preferably to 15 degrees Celsius compared to preindustrial
levels

World community is getting closer towards a unified collaborative effort to curb
GreenHouse Gas (GHG) emission The scale of the problem has been taken seriously
by most of the developed nations Promotion of Renewable Energy (RE) and
adoption of enhanced efficiency at every stage has been envisaged  RE
technologies have become cost competitive and in some parts of the world
cheapest energy solutions The cost of RE Technology is still falling A rapid
growth of RE based energy usage throughout the world has been observed in recent
years Both the developed and developing world are taking an equally optimistic
approach towards popularizing RE technologies and working jointly to make this
world livable for our next generation  In the year 2015 the world has seen a
remarkable change in the new power capacity addition  for the first time in the
history of the modern world the new addition of renewable power capacity has
exceeded the capacity addition of conventional power generation

Different countries of the world are now setting policies of low carbon or
carbon free energy sector Bangladesh is also following the same path

Keeping in mind the shift of energy sector towards greener technologies United
International University is going to organize the 6th International Conference
on the Developments in Renewable Energy Technology ICDRET’21 on December
2830 2021 at Dhaka Bangladesh Like the previous ICDRETs we expect
participation from all tiers of RE sector to make the conference a useful forum
for sharing experiences exchanging the views and helping to forge a long
lasting bonding between the academia industry and the people involved in the
dissemination of the technology at the grass root level

Scope

ICDRET 2021 will cover all aspects of Renewable Energy The topics of interest
include but are not limited to —

1    Solar PV technology (Cell level and efficiency level)

2    Solar PV application

3    Wind energy

4    Biomass biogas and biofuel

5    Integration of renewable energy applications in grid areas

6    Hydro and other renewable energy sources

7    RE policy pricing and regulatory issues

8    RE applications

9    RE storage

10  RE trading

11  Green Building and Green Industry

Full papers not submitted or published elsewhere should be written in English
and are to be submitted in PDF format The paper should be prepared in IEEE
format (double column 10 point) The submitted full paper should be in camera
ready form and must not exceed 6 printed pages All the figures and diagrams
should be in black and white For further details about the format of the paper
please see the ICDRET website (wwwicdretuiuacbd) The authors should
strictly follow the submission guideline; otherwise the paper may not be
published in the proceedings Special care should be taken for figures and
diagrams Please note that very thin lines small captions or small/light
symbols in the figures often do not appear clearly once printed in the
proceedings Make sure that the lines are thick enough and captions and symbols
are large enough so that they are reproduced correctly in the proceedings

before the date of conference The deadline for sending the presentation file by

advisable to keep the length of the presentation within 10–12 minutes
